tool_description: Direct access to up-to-date, expert-selected global economic news. Ideal for financial analysis and economic trend monitoring. This API provides constant updates and precise data, essential for professionals and enthusiasts in the fast-evolving world of global economy.
name: Global Economy News
title: Global Economy News

api_list.name: Get Articles
api_list.description: This method allows you to obtain articles by performing Boolean queries.

required_parameters.name: country
required_parameters.description:
## Country Selection for News Queries

Please use lowercase ISO country codes for news queries, e.g., use **\\\\\\\"es\\\\\\\" (lowercase)** for Spain. This ensures relevant results for the intended country. Available country codes include:
- `de` for Germany
- `es` for Spain
- `fr` for France
- `gb` for the UK
- `it` for Italy
- `nl` for the Netherlands
- `pl` for Poland
- `pt` for Portugal
- `ru` for Russia
- `us` for the United States of America

You can find more information about the accepted countries in the **About** section.

required_parameters.name: category
required_parameters.description:
### Defines a category among those available:
Example:  
- Banking
- Business
- Currency
- DeFi
- Economy
- Energy
- Fiat
- Finance
- Fund
- Insurance
- Job
- Market
- Real Estate
- Startup
- Tax
- Trade
- Transport
- Venture Capital

optional_parameters.name: query
optional_parameters.description:
## Query Expressions with Keywords and Filters: Using Boolean Operators

- **Combine keywords and filters** for precise searches.
- **Boolean operators** (`AND`, `OR`, `NOT`) enable specific query refinements.

### Examples:
- `site:lavanguardia.com` - Searches within a specific domain.
- `Tesla AND Elon` - Both keywords must be present.
- `title:Tesla` - Filters by keyword in the title.
- **Combined**: `site:ft.com AND title:(Tesla AND Elon)` - Searches articles with multiple conditions.

optional_parameters.name: final
optional_parameters.description:
## Final Data-Time Delimiter
- Defines the **final time delimiter** in Unix Time format (milliseconds).
- **Example**:
  - `1705878000000`
- Defaults to **Now** if not specified.

optional_parameters.name: initial
optional_parameters.description:
## Initial Date-Time Limit Reference
- Specify the **initial date-time limit** in Unix time (milliseconds).
- **Example**:
  - `1705791600000`
- Defaults to **-1 month ago** if not specified.
